perturbation.original_text: Section 1.01 Appointment. Lessor hereby appoints the Company, and the Company hereby agrees to accept such appointment, as the agent of Lessor, without any fee for acting as such agent, pursuant to the terms and conditions of this Agreement, for the purpose of ordering and, subject to the conditions set forth in Section's 2.01 and 2.05 hereof, accepting Equipment on Lessor's behalf for leasing to the Company under the Lease from the respective supplier thereof (each a "Supplier" and collectively, the "Suppliers"). It is specifically agreed that all of the power and authority vested to the Company herein shall be subject to any modifications as may from time to time be made by Lessor.
perturbation.changed_text: Section 1.01 Appointment. Lessor hereby appoints the Company, and the Company hereby agrees to accept such appointment, as the agent of Lessor, without any fee for acting as such agent, pursuant to the terms and conditions of this Agreement, for the purpose of ordering and, subject to the conditions set forth in Section's 2.01 and 2.05 hereof, accepting Equipment on Lessor's behalf for leasing to the Company under the Lease from the respective supplier thereof (each a "Supplier" and collectively, the "Suppliers"). It is specifically agreed that all of the power and authority vested to the Company herein shall be subject to any modifications as may from time to time be made by Lessor. Notwithstanding the foregoing, the Company's appointment as agent is irrevocable during the term of this agreement.
perturbation.explanation: The original text states that the Lessor can modify the power and authority vested in the Company. The added sentence states that the appointment is irrevocable during the term. This creates a contradiction as to whether the Lessor can actually modify the Company's authority.

perturbation.original_text:
Section 3.01 Termination.

(a) So long as no default exists and is continuing hereunder or under the Lease, either party may terminate this Agreement at any time upon ____________ (______30________) days written notice to the other party; provided however that such termination shall not act as a termination of any Equipment leased hereunder.

(b) In the event the Company is in default hereunder or under the Lease, Lessor may elect to terminate this Agreement immediately, which shall be effective upon the receipt of written notice thereof by the Company.

(c) Any termination under this Section 3.01 shall automatically result in the immediate revocation of all authority vested in the Company under this Agreement to order, accept or pay for any Equipment on behalf of Lessor.
perturbation.changed_text:
Section 3.01 Termination.

(a) So long as no default exists and is continuing hereunder or under the Lease, either party may terminate this Agreement at any time upon ____________ (______30________) days written notice to the other party; provided however that such termination shall not act as a termination of any Equipment leased hereunder.

(b) In the event the Company is in default hereunder or under the Lease, Lessor may elect to terminate this Agreement immediately, which shall be effective upon the receipt of written notice thereof by the Company.

(c) Any termination under this Section 3.01 shall automatically result in the immediate revocation of all authority vested in the Company under this Agreement to order, accept or pay for any Equipment on behalf of Lessor. Notwithstanding any termination under this Section 3.01, the Company retains the authority to manage and maintain any Equipment already leased under this agreement.
perturbation.explanation: Section 3.01(c) states that termination automatically revokes all authority. The added sentence states that despite termination, the Company retains authority to manage and maintain equipment already leased. This is a direct contradiction regarding the scope of authority after termination, creating uncertainty about the Company's responsibilities and rights.
